intro: Alaternus glabra, commonly known as the smooth alaternus, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or shaded areas. Alaternus glabra is noted for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
